plan: In the initial rounds, I will test aggressive bidding by slightly exceeding my value to gauge competitors' strategies. If consistently outbid, I'll pivot to conservative bidding, slightly below my value, to minimize losses. I'll also experiment with random high bids to disrupt patterns and gather data on Betty and Charles' responses. Mid-game, I'll analyze bid history to identify trends and adjust accordingly. In later rounds, I'll refine my strategy by balancing risk and reward, aiming to bid close to my value. Throughout, I'll prioritize data collection to optimize long-term profit, adjusting tactics as needed based on observed behaviors.

In the initial rounds, I'll test aggressive bidding by matching or slightly exceeding my value to assess others' bidding tendencies. Mid-game, I'll experiment with underbidding (10-20% below my value) to explore profit margins and detect patterns in opponents' bids. In later rounds, I'll refine my strategy by balancing between aggressive and conservative bids based on observed behaviors, aiming to optimize profit. I'll also occasionally place random bids to gather data on opponents' reactions, especially in tie situations. This dynamic approach will help maximize long-term profit by adapting to opponents' strategies and bid patterns.

In the initial rounds, I'll bid slightly below my value to gather data on Andy's and Betty's strategies. If they consistently bid low, I'll bid aggressively, close to my value, to maximize profit. If they bid high, I'll undercut them slightly to win efficiently. In mid-game, I'll experiment with random aggressive bids to disrupt patterns and test their reactions. Towards the final rounds, I'll refine my strategy based on observed behaviors, potentially using a mix of conservative and aggressive bids to optimize profit while minimizing losses. I'll adapt continuously based on their bidding trends.

Next, I'll test moderate bids slightly above my value to gauge competitors' aggression. I'll mix in occasional low bids to assess their consistency. By mid-game, I'll analyze patterns for strategic adjustments, balancing risk and reward to optimize long-term profit while minimizing unnecessary losses.

In upcoming rounds, I'll bid 10-20% below my value, adjusting based on opponents' bids. Occasionally, I'll bid slightly above the second-highest bid, if predictable, to maximize profit. I'll also place random bids to gather data on opponents' strategies, refining my approach as patterns emerge.

Next, I'll bid slightly above the second-highest bid from last round, around 25, to test if Andy and Betty maintain low bids. If they adjust, I'll progressively increase my bids closer to my value, balancing risk and reward to identify their bidding patterns.

I'll bid slightly below my value to minimize losses and observe competitors' reactions. Occasionally, I'll test higher bids to disrupt patterns. Mid-game, I'll analyze trends to refine my strategy, aiming for balanced risk and reward. Prioritize data collection to adapt tactics for maximizing long-term profit.

In the next rounds, I'll bid 5-10% below my value, adjusting based on opponents' patterns. Occasionally, I'll bid slightly above the second-highest bid when predictable. I'll also use random bids to gather data, refining my strategy to balance winning chances with maximizing profit.

In the next rounds, I'll bid slightly above the average of Andy's and Betty's previous bids when my value is high. For low values, I'll bid conservatively. I'll occasionally use random aggressive bids to disrupt patterns and observe their reactions, refining my strategy based on their adjustments.
